JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant arrived at the PERSON airport in GPE with the intention to travel to GPE . The customs found on her QUANTITY and MONEY in cash which she had not reported in her customs declaration . The applicant was charged with smuggling of foreign currency , a criminal offence under LAW .

On DATE the Golovinskiy District Court of GPE found the applicant guilty as charged and imposed a suspended sentence of CARDINAL months’ imprisonment conditional on CARDINAL months’ probation . It also ordered that the applicant ’s money be reverted to the ORG .

Counsel for the applicant submitted a statement of appeal , in which he argued , in particular , that the money had been reverted to the ORG unlawfully since it had not been instrument of any offence .
On DATE ORG upheld the conviction on appeal . As regards the money , it noted as follows :
“ According to a clarification issued by ORG of GPE , objects of smuggling include foreign currency . ”
ORG did not indicate the legal provision , on which the confiscation measure was based .
Counsel filed an application for supervisory review , claiming in particular that the courts had decided on the destiny of physical evidence in breach of the relevant provisions of LAW .
On DATE ORG rejected his application in the following terms :

“ The argument that the court[s ] had breached the requirements of LAW of LAW in making the decision on the destiny of physical evidence – which the currency seized from PERSON was recognised to be – is unsubstantiated because the physical evidence had been reverted to the State in accordance with LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW . ”
On DATE ORG of GPE refused institution of supervisory - review proceedings in the case .
On DATE a deputy President of ORG set aside ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE and referred the counsel ’s complaint for examination to ORG of ORG .

On DATE the ORG of ORG reviewed the complaints which had been submitted by the applicant ’s counsel and by the first deputy to the GPE prosecutor , and held that the conviction and confiscation order had been lawful and justified .
On DATE , following a new application for supervisory review introduced by the deputy Prosecutor General , a judge of ORG decided to institute supervisory - review proceedings before ORG .

On DATE ORG upheld the applicant ’s conviction of smuggling under LAW but quashed the confiscation order on the ground that the applicant ’s money had not been criminally acquired or illegally obtained . The amount confiscated was to be repaid to the applicant .
On DATE the ORG requested the ORG to indicate whether the money had been repaid to the applicant .
By letter of CARDINAL DATE , the ORG submitted a payment document , according to which the amount of MONEY had been credited to the applicant ’s account on DATE .
By letters of DATE and DATE , the applicant confirmed that the money had been repaid to her .

LAW of the Russian Federation provides that smuggling , that is movement of large amounts of goods or other objects across the customs border of GPE , committed by concealing such goods from the customs or combined with non - declaration or inaccurate declaration of such goods , carries a penal sanction of up to DATE imprisonment ( LAW ) .
